title: Sure, here is a reading list of 20 articles focusing on complex reasoning in natural language processing (NLP) with an emphasis on pretrained language models (PLMs). These articles are selected to provide a comprehensive understanding of the current state of research in this area
Pre-training of Deep Bidirectional Transformers for Language Understanding"** by Jacob Devlin et al
**"RoBERTa: A Robustly Optimized BERT Pretraining Approach"** by Yinhan Liu et al
**"XLNet: Generalized Autoregressive Pretraining for Language Understanding"** by Zhilin Yang et al
**"T5: Exploring the Limits of Transfer Learning with a Unified Text-to-Text Transformer"** by Colin Raffel et al
**"ALBERT: A Lite BERT for Self-supervised Learning of Language Representations"** by Zhenzhong Lan et al
**"GPT-3: Language Models are Few-Shot Learners"** by Tom B
Pre-training Text Encoders as Discriminators Rather Than Generators"** by Kevin Clark et al
**"DeBERTa: Decoding-enhanced BERT with Disentangled Attention"** by Pengcheng He et al
**"Longformer: The Long-Document Transformer"** by Iz Beltagy et al
**"UnifiedQA: Crossing Format Boundaries with a Single QA System"** by Khashayar Khashabi et al
Retrieval-Augmented Generation for Knowledge-Intensive NLP Tasks"** by Patrick Lewis et al
**"Turing-NLG: A 17-billion-parameter Language Model by Microsoft"** by Microsoft Research
Denoising Sequence-to-Sequence Pre-training for Natural Language Generation, Translation, and Comprehension"** by Mike Lewis et al
Enhanced Representation through Knowledge Integration"** by Yu Sun et al
**"SpanBERT: Improving Pre-training by Representing and Predicting Spans"** by Mandar Joshi et al
**"DistilBERT, a distilled version of BERT: smaller, faster, cheaper and lighter"** by Victor Sanh et al
**"Reformer: The Efficient Transformer"** by Nikita Kitaev et al
**"Big Bird: Transformers for Longer Sequences"** by Manzil Zaheer et al
**"Switch Transformers: Scaling to Trillion Parameter Models with Simple and Efficient Sparsity"** by William Fedus et al
**"GShard: Scaling Giant Models with Conditional Computation and Automatic Sharding"** by Noam Shazeer et al

These articles cover a range of topics from the foundational models like BERT and GPT-3 to more specialized models and techniques that address specific challenges in complex reasoning and long document processing. They also include advancements in model efficiency and scalability, which are crucial for practical applications of PLMs in NLP
